name: Path N
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:** Histological examination of a regional lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 12 or more lymph nodes; histological examination of an inguinal lymphadenectomy specimen will ordinarily include 6 or more lymph nodes. If the lymph nodes are negative, but the number ordinarily examined is not met, classify as pN0.

**Note 2:**  Code only regional nodes, and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis .
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Unknown; regional lymph nodes not stated
Not documented in patient record

Unilateral or bilateral:
    Anorectal
    Inferior hemorrhoidal
    Lateral sacral (laterosacral)
    Perirectal

Regional lymph node(s), NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1

Metastasis in unilateral internal iliac AND/OR
Unilateral inguinal lymph node(s)

Unilateral:
       Internal iliac (hypogastric)
       Obturator
       Superficial inguinal (femoral)

Stated as N2

Metastasis in perirectal and inguinal lymph nodes AND/OR
Bilateral internal iliac AND/OR
Bilateral inguinal lymph nodes

Bilateral:
      Internal iliac (hypogastric)
      Obturator
     Superficial inguinal (femoral)

Stated as N3
